S.FORM: W sla te nag, singsi motane, ciausɨ so pakbaka, “icikla！su ku bu！”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: La pe ta ra dro ke na me psobaka, “Singsi margagimusu.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: I sulte ne me dria, u buru buru nema singsi sisipi na beké na m ɨ.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Ruaki language of numbers.

S.FORM: Ang pa ra na mɨ singsi na sisipi, su thɨné nga na mɨ sisipi thɨné.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: Madro arigwa li na makacuku nga na beka.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Ruaki languages.

S.FORM: Makavienenga mwa sulte, kbu bulu beké ta, m pso ba ka ma kɨ biciringi nina na.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Ruaki language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: A ki aracɨ li ka Utagɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Utagɨ。
My name is Utagɨ.

S.FORM: Ma mi ne ma aracɨ dra ka Adriyu.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Adriyu。
My dad’s name is Adriyu.

S.FORM: Ni ne ma aracɨ dra ka Mumuni.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Mumuni。
My mother’s name is Mumuni.

S.FORM: Ikɨ cacɨvélé ka mɨngesɨle cɨvé li.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: I ké kua sesa na kaka sovɨlé, aracɨ dra ka Sɨsɨgɨ, cɨvélé dra ka mɨngesɨle kesesanɨ
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Sɨsɨgɨ，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Sɨsɨgɨ, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: Terese ke na me iké sesa na gako sulsulte.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: Kɨkɨ si kakinema sovlé ka madalamɨ namɨ thɨné.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: Madalamɨ kɨ lungulungé, I sa se dra ne me ka, a ngu ru bua kename thɨkadane mua lungulungé.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: Madalamɨ kɨ merariku na boua lɨsé, nuduru ma kɨneme teresɨ thɨné si lungulungé.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: Drekai cuku kɨkɨ vɨlavɨlakɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我是魯凱族的小孩。
I am an Rukai child.

S.FORM: Iké da na me Teledreka.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在茂林。
Our family lives in Teledreka.

S.FORM: Da na mɨ ka iké tarima na ico.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: Da na mɨ iké taturu na le ma ta ketaka.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: Kɨkɨ si mama, nina, kaka sovlé, kaka abéya teresɨ kɨ namɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: Maragere maminema, maminema ka késacu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Marɨlé Ninema, ninema ka kuisan.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: Iky ni mama dane ka u teldredrekane nema pusobaka.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Rukai language with us at home.

S.FORM: Isasɨdra name ki buburanemɨ ka abɨrɨ kɨnamɨ sɨviri cɨkɨlɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: kɨkɨ si kaka sovlé kaka abéya amua namɨ puara tkorpangɨ
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Sakura kɨkɨ madalamɨ thɨkadang namɨ na ico.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: Sesa nungeresɨ ma kɨ ninema mua bɨrlɨlé.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: Lilepɨ ni tɨbɨlɨnga temalesɨsɨkɨ vyénɨ ikatilekɨ si ikɨrapa, mabɨlɨsbɨsɨ.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: Iké namɨ suro déta kwonɨ pan avé udrerapese nɨma, sakura margi.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: Vévanenga, tɨbɨlɨnga ngépelanga matililyengɨ
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: Kiburuburu kɨkɨ ninɨma, nakuni matililyenge nga tɨbɨlɨnga.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為什麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: Nina masobaka, amé nukɨné ma na sɨbɨrɨ
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: Ngiyubu tɨbɨlɨnga ka tédra kurungu, cacɨngalɨ ka mubuolenga.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: Nugiama namɨ nga siviri.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: Siviri neme daderanɨ, patuluru kɨ cacɨngalɨ peké kɨdredreme li msobaka.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: Sɨmarnga sɨbɨrɨ ikuani, api berɨlɨlé kwa
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: Gako li iké danamɨ pila, odɨvadɨvacɨ kɨ mua gako, la dɨvadɨvacɨ kɨ siviri.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: Ikɨtaradro gako namɨ, ikadro séto, makasi rɨsama kɨnamɨ mɨmrigrigu.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Iku valɨvalɨke nga iké beladɨ, isarɨbu, mililivi babangɨ, si modradrɨke.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: Gako tuména teradro na thekadanɨ, sinsi ka teresɨ nɨma a mililivi.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: Makavénenga tasisyepɨ ma kɨnamɨ, tapitibula ciuosɨ sisyepɨ
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: Iké na ico udrisidrisi tanva, si lake na ico usisyepɨ.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: Uruku kenamɨ syepɨ Gako makatɨpuruanga, mvalevala depɨ, gako ka makavénenga mubula nga.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: Kusia, ka amua kɨkɨ cɨkɨlɨ homong mia mumona.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: Médavɨlinga ipcacɨngla nemɨ, sikdrɨdrɨmɨ kɨdria.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: Cɨngɨlɨning kua mumu ka, pakanɨ kwa suika, la ponglu kwa ocia.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: Mumu atuka ni suika ka malemɨmɨ, marigi guonɨ madɨ.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: Madɨlamɨ kwa ocia ni mumu, margi ngulu madɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: A vévanɨ ni ka, kɨkɨ si kakorongo teresɨ kɨnamɨ tékane kedrali.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: Sakura margi tékana ni kɨdrali kakrongo, iké akange, iké tɨroga, iké tɨngɨtɨngɨ, si laké mumolɨ ia.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: Mkakanɨ nɨmɨ nga kedrali ka, amua kɨnamɨ tɨlacɨnga klacɨngɨ.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: Madro arani bɨrathi kakorongo, até si rakio la péng kwa, ngɨmca psiviri mia.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: A mua kɨdria tila nugiyadra takɨdrɨngému mia msobaka skakulanɨnga nomakɨmua cɨnglɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道謝，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: Sesa ka umɨcɨ nɨma singsi mwa tɨbrlelara cɨnglɨ na makagulugulé nga, idilipi kɨnamɨ iké sodadana longé kipu
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Mɨdanɨ neme nga adringi, lapsobaka singsi, “tlucubunga ka maka raramɨ nga, kodrɨnga ka maka sura nga, rikɨmania cɨngcɨnglɨ lia.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: Akurudru kɨ sura, sukéli ikɨdalemɨ cngɨeleɨ maka sura nga.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: Madro acɨngɨngla li raramɨ, iké angatu thilithilibi, laké tɨralubu angatu adringi siyerekɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: Tɨberlɨlara adringi ka iké cɨgo, rɨgi si rukulo, icɨngcɨngla li tuminia na tɨradro makagulugulénga ka, sesa cɨnglɨ li nga ka mabɨbɨrɨ kɨkɨ.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: Madro pasiasinga li siasingi, pcɨngɨlɨ ma kɨ mama na si nina na.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: Skakulanga ngeresɨ ma kɨ mama si nina na mukɨné.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: Kɨné tébabarvia, kɨkɨ si kaka abéya amua namɨ Taito homon mia mama na.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: Saliké namɨ Taihoku kiudu kisia mwa Taito.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: Mui nɨme nga Taito, mama sukɨné nga désiaba ondéng sidosia drɨsngɨ nɨma.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: Da dra mama édadɨlé tésiaba, ondéng ni sidosia ka isipiylɨ su wa nga.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家很近，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: Mama da dra bila ka iké tɨradro tɨthathada na makagulugulénga, angɨrngɨlɨ namɨ avétha dria.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: Iké nɨme tɨthathada dria mama lamɨcɨ nɨma pɨkanɨ iyu si kiudu rɨgi.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: Ku ngiyubu nga, langɨresɨ namɨ mwa lɨdrɨke tɨkiubu.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: Lɨdrɨke madro na sidosia, sukénɨme ngotoby mwa dria.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: Kugia minɨmenga, cɨnglɨ nɨme otoby ka kiuba dria, takorongé ngobasu gia.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: Siviri nɨme Taihoku nga, mokunua nga otoby dra mama.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: A valɨvalɨke nɨme ka iké namɨ sdanɨ Oponoho, sullte nɨme nga ka, suwanga aula Takau, iké lɨdreke sékacu mia.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在萬山，上學以後，就搬到了高雄，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Oponoho. After I started school, we moved to Kaohsiung and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: Muili sulte daikakusé nga, la kbuburu poké sesa na kɨcarisia sulate, rigu ku Taiuan kɨcarisia makacuku nga na margi bunka.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Sukéni cacɨvélé tébarbarvia ka, kɨkɨ si kaka sovlé su siviri nga namɨ cɨkɨlɨ kbuburu marudrɨngɨ, tarigu ku cuku ta si bunka ta mia.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: Kɨné marudrangɨ ka mvarlu cevél dra, makasi cnglɨ madɨ armé na thɨbarɨ la na ico.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: Kibuburu kɨdria aci ku ariguasu na bka, urugu Pupunganɨ, mathuré psobaké dra, laigu Kunadavan bka, Auba si Sodé na bka.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的萬山語說得很流利，也會說多納語、青葉語和霧台話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Oponoho, as well as Kongadavane, Japanese and Vudavudadhane.

S.FORM: Kiburuburu kɨ dria laigu kɨ, avalɨvalɨke dra ka kiburu buru Pupunganɨ bka, asiradra ka Kunadavan ico, tikadra kamlu ka madro so Auba ico, sukédra rigu makabaka nga.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學萬山話，太太是多納人，而他工作上認識許多青葉人，所以他會這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Oponoho language when he was a child, his wife is an Kongadavane, and he knows many Japanese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: Tika nɨme mabka dria, ki marudrangɨ la porkéké ululupu na sakiké sirigu.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: Ipta pɨdrɨngɨ namɨ piciringi rigu, makasi iké nɨma dénva saké luing mia, duru pɨtapɨdrɨngé ligiri rigu.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: A valɨvalɨke li ka irigu kɨ cuku li si bunka li, langirigu kɨkɨ kcarisian kɨ mia ikeela maurumalɨ matɨ.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Rigu mdɨnga ngédro ka, la rigu madɨ Drekai cuku ico mia, sakwa angula, uduru madɨ pkiluvu.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為魯凱族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Rukai is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: Sesa ngiubu gili sovlé nukɨla ma aɨbɨrɨ nga.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: A mwa namɨ tɨlanlanra longé toroka kakorongo, zunbi mia pɨtaramɨ gili sovlé tlacngɨ tékɨnanɨ kiubu.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: Orbatɨ namɨ tlanngra lɨcenge, madro dria na marigi bouala lɨcenge.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: Onglɨngé namɨ konsing lɨcenge, tɨlacɨ si tétho ia.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: Pila olɨngélɨngé na kodamono lawpan lapsobka, malɨmɨmɨ pngudrele li si mɨnedɨ longia ngitkici!
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: La lɨngé nga namɨ pngudrɨle si menedɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: La ribatɨ namɨ tlanngɨra butulu, laupan sopusobaka “nolɨngara su? toroka ka tradro si lakucuru, sesa ka turu ɨdé.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: Kakorongo ka makcɨngéma, kbubura laupan na dru ma ptimɨrɨ.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: Makasi laupan ka masobka mamɨrɨ nga, iduru ovavara lia.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: Iku pila laupan masobka, nanga longia akangɨ li, akangɨ li ka teradro si la kɨmɨrɨ.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Iprilanga olɨngé namɨ akangɨ si toroka, siviri tɨdamé sesa cukué na kɨnɨ.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: Tikɨlamna drodro, masungu nga avé.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: La dénva psiviri gili sovlé psobaka, idruru séka mia hétai ma, skanicuobi nga ka duru ma siviri abɨrɨ.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: Kakorongo masobka tésdamɨra li madro, tila ngurubua mukené kuonɨ mia ma!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: Nanga mukɨnia ma namɨ lɨmngmngnɨ tkɨrɨsɨ kuonɨ margi na kiubu.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: Iké kwa sesa na dokiusé aracɨ dra ka Sisipu, maimimuru ɨngmcɨ na sakiké.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Sisipu，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Sisipu, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: Sultɨ dra dria, kidri la kébébé dokiusé na ingpicu, sidrisidrisi si sulatɨ ia.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: Kuualɨ, kupsalɨ, kutrulu, rɨsa no ma bui dra ksédemɨ.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: Makasi iké nia na makurathɨ sasiké, mémani nga ksédemɨ sakiké si isvéré.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Brinɨnga ka rɨsama aunɨ bui dria ksédemɨ nga.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: Iké sesa na viéne, angurubwa namɨ brɨlɨlé mwa bɨlatɨ.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: Dadɨranɨ dria, Sisipu lapiua béncio, makasi maimuru ɨngmcɨ na sasidrisidrisi sulatɨ.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Sisipu想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Sisipu wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: La kbébé dokiusé sidrisidrisi na sulatɨ, makasi rɨsama biri dria msobaka, imecɨ kɨ mia nia.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: Sisipu la dirvanɨ tubi mgaucu msobaka, nakumu rɨsamia aunɨ ksédemɨ kwa sidrisidrisi sulatɨ!!
S.TRANSL: Sisipu 急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!
Sisipu burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: La psobaka nia dokiusé, iduru musu mlémɨcɨ, ksédemɨ ni swa na sakiké, si iduru musu sasɨvéré!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: Misyenɨnga, Sisipu anglaksɨ mukɨné gako, Sisipu la ra sovri nga dria késɨdɨma dra na sakiké bui dokiusé.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Sisipu很早就到學校了，Sisipu把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Sisipu arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Sisipu la sukubu dokiusé dra, psobaka kuyɨnɨnga nungimɨcɨ makɨ sakiké kwa, takdrengé mu mia dokiusé dra drianɨ duru ksédemɨ driana sakiké.
S.TRANSL: Sisipu向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Sisipu apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: Maninɨma ka amani cɨkɨlɨ namɨ ululupu na ico.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: Avalɨvalɨke li ka, mama si gili dria mama ka iké na masungu mbalte mélémɨcɨ lɨvasɨ si kuongɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: Mɨlerɨ ni nga, la plémɨcɨ nga arani na bɨrɨ pabɨrɨ.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: Iké kdruma na vlisɨne, iké rɨva, iké kdruma na dmathɨ ia.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: Iké sodadanɨ tɨbabarvia pavalvala nga aradra bobé cɨkɨlɨ ico.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: Tésa upungu kɨkɨ mama na, ksapara makɨ mama na mwa ulupu mia.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Mama lapsobaka taradro li nga ka numɨcɨ ma kwa ngɨresɨ mwa ma.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: Cɨkɨlɨ na sovalé ka urugu saké tukuru na bɨrɨ, largu saké na tɨrɨbɨ si alapi drodralɨ na sakiké tkuru.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: Maminɨma ka urugu pétha tɨrɨbɨ sa tkuru, mama masobka, kɨné saké pora na dmathe, taptapɨdrɨngɨ cɨnglɨ tkapnga dra bɨrɨ, tkuru ka piké ti sanké dra na bɨrɨ dodavce dadɨranɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: Kérké kɨkɨ kuibungu mia ngeresɨ patɨmanɨ ico mwa ulupu, makavienɨgna kɨkɨ kbuburu pétha tɨrɨbɨ, nusipiyla apétha li na tɨrɨbɨ ka duru ma tukuru na bɨrɨ.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: Mama cɨnglɨ dra nga lapsobaka kwa kuiyenɨnga nukɨmani ma musu amani na makɨcɨngɨ nga ululupu na ico mia.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: Kené nga tradro nga kɨkɨ, la kɨvécé kɨ pɨna si rɨvél li, ksapara mama na mwa ulupu.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Abɨrɨ nɨme nga tbarbarvia mɨradria bɨrɨ pavlavla boby cɨkɨlɨ name ico masiarara.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: Masobka mama, takdrɨngé ni taia pɨlɨngɨ ta buimitia tkargia, la duru miti mra ngédro makabɨrɨ nga.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: muili gako mierɨ ka isubribrili kɨkɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: muili gako ka, maimuru kɨkɨ emɨcɨ kabangɨ.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: tédra na amɨcaliya.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: sulteli ka, angeresɨ kɨkɨ leséli cɨngɨlɨ sulate.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: skéngknamɨ ka, pasakéngkua lséli ingpicu si sdrisdrisi.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: aki sinsi ka sasimaca
S.TRANSL: The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”
adra isubribrilinga mangkua!""

S.FORM: lséli ka kukui, vlakɨ ni drukay zuku kini.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫kukui，他也是魯凱族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is kukui, and he is also an Rukai child.

S.FORM: terɨsɨ kɨnamɨ iké teldreka sulsultɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在茂林魯凱讀書。
We study together in the Teldreka tribe.

S.FORM: sitalsɨ kɨnamɨ biciringi maurudrenge tububuru urugu kɨname téldrɨdrɨkane.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說魯凱語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Rukai proficiently.

S.FORM: maragre si lakucuru kɨkɨ, kukui ka tikca si lakerɨlé.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，kukui很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while kukui is short and thin.

S.FORM: sakura kcɨngna ki kukui, rsamania mdalme ico.
S.TRANSL: kukui很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
kukui is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: ungdokai sesa gakko madro ku nupakelani.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: iké na mabablibli tési okdangɨ babngɨ thurobu si opna.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: makela kɨkɨ na opdakɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: iburo kɨkɨ pidɨkeli apulobu pukuli.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: makasi icɨkalɨ kɨkɨ pidɨkela.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: mtamolinga tathaneda ka mabebere rsamia ico.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: kumédra ikmani kɨkɨ thamdalɨngenga makasi mabeberekua patarpɨngɨ kɨkɨ kné makela.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: amua kɨname cɨngɨlɨ mama na.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: macukarɨ kuku ni ki mama.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: utilanma mama iki dane cvalri ka maburutu.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: aki kukula mini cɨvarli ka salké cɨvarli iburo ki mama.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: umɨcɨ mama buetɨ ni nuengɨ si thvéké bui mama na.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: tesesɨ kname mama iké tisierka modradrɨke madro ku tububuru masiarara ni.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: iku kugia mili nga ka maragre musu nga si lakthabre musu nga mangkua ki mama.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: margagi ni nga kuku su ka muknia dane berlɨlé maknia mama na.
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: iki 2022 cɨvéllé ka ukaigi séhu poké mingbungsio ni kecarisia ka udruru manmaninga saké aracɨ ta kcarsia.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: kiburuburu kɨkɨ na mémani nibénma séhu sulte ngiculu aracɨ name kɨcarsia bui nma mia na cɨkɨlɨ thbarɨ ki sɨsɨgɨ thalmaro.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年ubakɨ。
I interviewed ubakɨ, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: matatila kɨname nukémakname kné tébarɨbarɨviyanɨ kububuru nia.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: utilangkua salkaneni aracɨ ni si la prigu kua thkadaneni cɨkɨcɨkɨlɨ ni.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: kiburuburu knia ka lakusu koborthi mianga aracɨsu makurathɨ tométa kné thamdalne aracɨ ta.
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: labiri kua ka ina aracɨni ciukukene ka idruru matkadrengé nga poké aracɨli ikéna ico kokoni kua ka 烏先生 mangkua aména tirimutu.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Wu Xian Sheng

S.FORM: iku ubakɨ ka, “asakéta aracɨ ta kɨcarisia sultɨ ka amani matɨkadrengé aracɨta. aracɨli ka pantomé na cɨkɨcɨkɨlɨli, thkadaneli, sakicoli sukéli takula silpe aracɨta mia.”
S.TRANSL: our family
ubakɨ said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: angeresɨ kɨkɨ kakurongo na mua tlangalanga umɨcɨ angidruka ni lɨcenge lapétha akanata kcarsia pavelavela ki kakurongo bui papɨréta.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: madelame ico tlanglanga ni kakurongo tɨngavlu si mongu ka madro olngé ico. lakadro ico mokné mélva tékanani.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和蕨菜很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: tékanani mongu si vituru ka sakura margi iké asaké tirimo thithi na butulu madro na brabra mukani tlanglanganme idilipi.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: tékane ni kakurongo ka laké kɨkɨ bila kivkivi brabra niknémia lakoko tililania kné lɨcenge ka angékmanianme druku muknia longé laiya kɨ.
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: isipielɨ angculu kname longlangé tɨlalanganme iki kakurongo ka takdrengé su iké paspara kua layia.
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: takparali nia kné ka madro kibuburali na ita kɨcarsia akangkana si adrudrukata larigu kɨ na tɨlanglanga na abrélé.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: cɨngɨlɨli skadrelameni akangkanata kakurongo ka sakura kɨ mabebere.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常高興。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
